body:
Hi all, 

Does someone know if it is possible to include electrical light in a glare simulation? 

I checked but did not find any Honeybee component to create a light or glow material. 

Thanks in advance!

Ale

replies.body: Hi Alejandro, Sorry for the late reply. The first solution is to use an IES file to create the electrical light in your scene. Honeybee has an IES>HB component for that. You can check [this discussion](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/simulating-ies-lamps-file-through-rad-materials?commentId=2985220%3AComment%3A1170056&groupId=2985220%3AGroup%3A658987) for more information. [](http://api.ning.com/files/DNRCvs-5-8H0e8m7nFjkW8XAxphfe1om5geGwx3CBN16XPUQdryMIW6HixPq3Tf2AkNeRxHE7pG105x7KnJvPiepGac0V0Gr/importSphereIES2.png) Moreover Honeybee is able to parse standard radiance materials as far as they don't have modifier so you can just type the material string and connect it to a surface and it should just work fine. Here is an example: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/W-BK82a1GssTRBKpkFDwr78BNyWK1ERUtKxWupvcenQ-ssOgn*Lso0byt6vLm59nd7TeoFdtvgVzcJNtMv4QsJ5ck3vK1Vyj/lightMaterial.png)
Thank you for your answer Mostapha! As always, very useful.
